text:
Saturday, 13 April 2013

More is More....?

Hello....hope this finds you all enjoying your Saturday whatever you're up to...I've had a productive day in the craft room...and had a bit of a 'Tilda Fest'...she has been a bit neglected of late and as I received 3 new stamps this week I thought I'll show her some after yesterdays CAS LOTV are some More is More Tilda

I love this colour combo...

This is my fav...

I wanted to use a different colour for me...just love this peachy look..

This card was made around these fab flowers from WOC....
Now I'm off to clean up my desk and maybe have another play...thank you for popping by...


  1. WOW Jan!!! You've been productive!!! All amazing cards!!! My favorite is... that's a tough one.. all of them, lol!!! Hugs, Brigitte

  2. Four fantastic cards Jan..gorgeous colours and details on all of them..beautiful.

    Luv CHRISSYxx

  3. OMG Jan ! Your cards are all exquisite ! The colours and embellies are sooooo beautiful ! As always your attention to details is second to none ! Hugs, blessings and love from Catherine

meeting sketches

these where some sketches that where done in a meeting and the scanner had a hard time reading them but I thought they still had some value. gotta keep sketching no matter where you are

Had to go to a see a client the other day and his office is at his home. There were goats, miniture horses and this beauty.. I couldn't resist getting the camera out.

April 02, 2011

Magnolia Down Under Challenge #90 - Metal Mania...Sweet Wonderful You!

Hey stampin' friends! I am back this afternoon to share the card I made for this week's Magnolia Down Under Challenge! The challenge is Metal Mania!!! I hope you can join us this week! The MDUC DT have gorgeous creations to inspire you this week so please stop by the MDU Challenge blog and have a peek and leave them some love!!!

I used more Hello Luscious paper and I coloured up this absolutely adorable Tilda with Flower Pot, from the Butterfly Dreams collection, with my Copics! I just love her to bits....sooooo cute!!!! I stamped a Magnolia sentiment on a tag cut with a QuicKutz die and I also used one of my CatsLife Press seal stamps, Officially Spring. I used two Making Memories metal butterflies to comply with this week's challenge to use some metal....I thought they were the perfect little embellishment too and I even bent up the wings a bit to add some dimension. To finish it off I add some gorgeous satin ribbon, green half pearls and some Stickles.  


Here is the inside...pretty simple, as always. I used a sentiment from the My Favorite Things More Essential Sentiments set and I used a MFT die-namics die

Well, thanks for stopping by again today to have a wee peek at my Magnolia Down Under Challenges card! Hope you can join the challenge!



Kirsty said...

Hi Wow she is so sweet and she pops right out of the page with your bright colours. Love the spring sentiment too. Never used any metal embellies before must have a go. The butterfly is such a cool finishing touch !! Kitty :)

Fleur said...

OMG Tara this is adorable ~ those butterflies are stunning & your colouring is awesome
Hugz Fleur xXx

heidy said...

Gorgeous Tara!
Hugs Heidy

Riet said...

So beautiful card Tara,I love the image and the colours.
So gorgeous papers.

Hugs Riet.xx

Katy said...

Tara this is stunning! I love the layout and the ribbon on the front and these DP's are so so yummy! Love everything about this. Hugs. Katy. xxx

Lorraine said...

Yow, gorgeous! Love the design, colors and your coloring of that sweet Tilda! Ooh and that ribbon & bow are luscious!

Georgia said...

Such a stunning card Tara, wow! This is so pretty, I love the gorgeous papers you've used and the embellishments are fab! :) Love, Georgia xx

Ohhh I've had the loveliest half hour having a wee nosey through your blog Tara! Think I might be your new stalker! ;)

Laurel’s Wreath

Sunday, January 23, 2011

Off the Wall Craftiness Challenge

Hi all - hope you have had a great weekend! I competed in the Off the Wall Craftiness blog challenge for Week 42. If you all haven't visited this blog - it is just great! There is a fun challenge posted each week. There are also cute stamps by Wilson Designs for sale - I used the Ride Away with Me stamp set for the challenge.

Here are the inspiration photo and challenge colors: orange, white, and teal.

Here is my card. In keeping with my latest vintage "craze", I used the challenge colors, but gave them a vintage feel. The DARLING typewriter stamp is from Wilson Designs. I also used stamps from Papertrey Ink, Stampin Up, Crafty Secrets and 7 Gypsies. The patterned paper is from my Cricut Imagine and DCWV. Hope you like it!

Supplies used:
Wilson Designs Ride Away with Me stamp set (typewriter)
Cricut Imagine Elise pattern cartridge
Cricut Paper Lace cartridge
Stampin' Up! Cardstock, Tiny Tags stamps, ribbon
Papertrey Ink Background Basics Text Style 2 stamps
Prima Flower
K & Company sticker
Hobby Lobby sticker
7 Gypsies stamps
Crafty Secrets stamps
Wilton Doily
Tim Holtz Clip
Paper: DCWV
Ink: Brilliance Beige, Memento Rich Cocoa, Tim Holtz Tea Dye Distress Ink
Punches: Marvy Uchida, EK Success


~Tammy~ said...

HELLO GORGEOUS layers of love! Outstanding use of the OTWC colors this week! This just makes my heart sing and Kim will LOVE that you used her set so beautifully! Thanks for sharing your beautiful card with us this week at OTWC and Good Luck! :-)

Amy said...

Love love all the layers especially the doily! You did a great job incorporating Kim's Wilson Designs stamp set in there! Great vintagy card! Thanks for playing along with OTWC this week!

Kim Wilson said...

Yayyyy Laurel! I am so elated to see you blogging! :) Thanks for using the set its adorable! Is it ok for me to add it to the gallery on the website?

Kay said...

VERY lovely card- I love that typewriter image, and it's just gorgeous on this card!

Post a Comment

28 of 30 Bloodbath: Superhero*

Bloodbath: Superhero*…. It’s almost December….



2 Responses to “28 of 30 Bloodbath: Superhero*”

  1. Crash! Landen Says:

    Thanks Sean C! Comments always welcomed…. There are more errors than just the one you pointed out actually (although I would argue that you CAN put your foot in that position. I just stood up and did it).

    This was just a quick drawing to complete the ‘one a day’ obligation that I had agreed to. I might even go far as to say that this was a ‘throwaway’. It was just meant to be a fun thing.

    I’m a bit sloppy anyway, though. I practice the ‘Dirty Mop’ style of Kung Fu (gong sounds)

  2. Sean C Says:

    Really late reply, I know. But I have to say that I really enjoy your artwork, really vibrant and bold. But I feel I have to comment on this artwork. The problem with this piece is his right foot, from our point of view the left, the ankle and foot cannot bend that way when the knee is facing us. Either adjust the position of the foot, or adjust the leg and the knee. A bit of reference might help here, whether it is a muscle mag or a photo of yourself making the pose.

    I really like the character, but I just feel that this should be pointed out. It’s a shame to see one tiny element take away from a strong piece.

I had the pleasure of spending a morning with my friend and fellow photog, Angie. We had the cutest little model! I had so much fun playing with him! And, boy, did he have his groove on for the camera!!

When we asked my eight year old niece how she won the award of "Camper of the Day" at her day camp, she simply answered, "I just made sure I smiled a lot and pretended I was enjoying everything."

She cracks me up and loves the camera! :)

Thursday, October 11, 2012

CI Paints - Sweet and Shimmery Card

Hi there Crafty Friends!  I'm Kimberly, and for my first official project on the CI Paint DT I chose to color a sweet little image and make a card.  I've used several fun colors from the expansive Creative Inspirations Paint line:  Carmel, Onyx, and Blue Ice.  I've also added a bit of clear glue along the edges of the flower I made, and sprinkled on some of the Resplendence Angel Dust glitter for even more sparkle.
The Creative Inspirations Paint I've used:
The Creative Inspirations Resplendence Glitter I've used:
Thanks so much for joining me today, and I'll be back with a new project on the 25th!

Your first post looks awesome! Beautiful use of the CI paints and love how this card turned out.

Beautiful card! So sorry it's been way too long since I've been in touch, seems like life just has a way of interfering sometimes. Hope you're doing well! HUGS!!

*Vicki* said...

Oh wow she's just adorable!! :) I love the shimmer you've added and gorgeous coloring!! HUGS

Davi said...

Sooo pretty Kimberly!! Love your coloring on the sweetie and the flower is beautiful :)

Joan Ervin said...

This is sooo cute, Kimberly!!!! You have used such a sweet image and I loooove all the sparkle!!!

Shannon White said...

Such a Darling Card and Super Sweet image! Love her Sparkly boots! 8-)

ok, really, really, really loving those paints and that glitter!!!!
Adorable card, too :-)

Saturday, October 9, 2010

Winners for Challenge 18--Monochromatic

I can't tell you how much I enjoyed ALL the creations you talented stampers made this week! My heart was going aflutter at all the beauty! Some of you said you struggled with monochromatic colors, others said you'd never tried it or rarely used them, so I was glad I challenged you to stamp outside your comfort zone, and I hope you use that theme more often!

Here are our designers' picks this week for the Cut Aboves:

Nance's choice: Linda Callahan

For all it's dark, gothic elegance I had to choose this stunning card from Linda Callahan. I love the starkness of the candelabra and spider web against all the rich designer papers and the Black Raven lace is just the perfect touch on a beautiful card...congratulations, Linda!

Jaydee's Pick: Rose's Vintage Santa

There were so many great cards this week, but this Christmas creation from Rose just stole my heart. I love the fact that Rose mixed the vintage feel paper with the crisp white of the more modern santa and the top note die. The ribbon and button are gorgeous! This card made me smile!

Lesley's Pick: Vicki Burdick
I chose Vicki's cute paper pads and matching cards in the "In Colours". The sweet little paper clips with the flowers and pearls really caught my eye! The "In Colour" designer paper looks amazing with this project!

Ann's Pick: Anne Marie HileWith all of the fabulous cards submitted this week, I found it difficult to select just one! However, I adored this stunning creation by Anne Marie Hile. I loved how the swirls on the embossed background complimented the swirls of the tree. From the shimmer paint to the rhinestones, the "bling" was glorious, resulting in a card that anyone would love to receive!

And my choice for the Headliner is:

The minute I saw this stunning gift bag that Ann made, I was head over heels!!! The unique color she used for a winter scene caught my eye right away, but the coloring, the attention to details and the fussy-cutting of her skaters put it over the top! I love the layout as well, and she even made a card to go with it! Congratulations, Ann, for being our Headliner of the Week!


  1. How exciting!!! You've made my day - thanks so much for the Headliner of the week award and I'm so glad you liked my gift bag. I loved the challenge and am looking forward to participating in more.

  2. Such beautiful cards - I am honored to be among them! Thanks Nance for the pick and all of your kind words - I'm still smiling :) And thanks LeAnne for the challenge - looking forward to more!

  3. Sucha gorgeous cards - congratulations to Ann - so well deserved my friend - I can't wait to see more! {{{hugs}}}

  4. Great challenge this week! Such great inspiration from everyone. Monochromatic is where it's at!

    Congrats to Ann, your bag is just stunning. I also want to say a special thank you to Ann S. for the recognition on my card. It is a huge honor coming from an artist who's work I admire so much. You made my day! :)

  5. Congrats, Ladies! I think all of these creations are lovely :)

  6. oh those cards are just totally gorgeous.
    Ann xxx

Hello there!

I've been on the Photojojo mailing list for a long time now but I've only just registered on this forum. I don't devote as much time as I'd like to photographic projects which is why I'm making a New Year's Resolution to do so.

I've just thought about setting myself a target of releasing one finished project per month throughout 2008. Hopefully I'll be able to stick to it...

To get myself started, I'll be taking part, as many probably will, in Project 365 in 2008. Starting from tomorrow, you will be able to follow my progress via Flickr -

Sep 22, 17 4:07 pm

I would recommend making it a GIF so it plays and loops automatically on all devices.


Hey David, Thanks


So much text yet your contribution to those projects remains unclear to me. Also can't really tell the difference between academic work or professional, it never really goes deep enough or becomes concrete enough. Is URBANFRAME perhaps just the name under which you do some competitions by yourself? The only workplace where you describe your personal tasks and role more precise was your internship, but you don't show any worksamples of the work you did, why? Also, your CV is unnecessary long for this stage of your career. Most often the CV should fit on one portrait page, max. two, so you can send it as a separate file and is easy to print.

Sep 23, 17 2:11 am

Hey randomized, Thanks for your valuable feedback.


They're more questions than feedback but you're welcome I guess, good luck with the job hunt or commission hunt!

So.. I agree myself as its a test run I thought let's give it a shot with text to explain the whole process. But clearly it's not helping.

And yes..Mentioning of specific roles and responsibilities...Going in right now.  So as this portfolio is specifically towards job applications..The idea was to show previews of what all varieties I have worked on and for interviews I have a 2nd detailed portfolio which I use to go in deeper into the projects. Urbanframe is a new name of the firm I work for as we are re-branding it, in addition to that I founded a platform where multiple events take place where by opening the office on a city level engagement.

as for CV, well thats a perspective , i dont entirely agree with the point "unnecessary long for this stage of your career". But thanks anyways. hope now i answered your questions. :)
